Tips on Scoring $1 Bus Tickets

Tips on finding coveted $1 bus tickets.

This is Part 2 of the 3-part Bus Booking Optimization Guide:

  • Part 1: Basics of Bus Booking Optimization
  • Part 2: Tips on Scoring $1 Bus Tickets
  • Part 3: Optimizing Bus Bookings by Carrier

Companies like Boltbus and Megabus are notorious for selling coveted $1 bus tickets. I‚Äôve gotten a few myself on otherwise pretty expensive routes, like San Francisco to Los Angeles.

If you‚Äôre aiming for scoring one of these tickets, consider the following tips:

I. Book 31-90 days in advance.

Busbud analyzed the probability of finding a $1 ticket by analyzing 1 million+ departures and found the following:

‚ÄúThe probability of finding a $1 bus ticket increases when you search a month in advance, hovering near the 4% mark when you search 31 days in advance, and reaches its peak with around the 90 day mark. The data becomes less reliable between 90 and 120 days as fewer people search that far in advance.‚Äù

Unlike other carriers, Greyhound specifically offers $1 buses only 31 days in advance and not any earlier.

Source

If the tickets are in fact in the $1-$5 price range, it‚Äôs well worth booking multiple dates if you aren‚Äôt sure when you‚Äôre traveling, instead of booking a $20-$30 ticket at the last minute.

II. Have a strategic travel window.

Friday and Sunday travel tend to be more expensive, as well as holidays and weekend times so weekday trips are generally best. Check all dates in that travel window across all bus sites on Wanderu.

III. Tuesdays or Wednesdays tend to be cheaper.

According to Busbud, you‚Äôre more likely to snag a $1 bus ticket set to travel on a Tuesday or Wednesday than a Friday or weekend, simply because demand for weekend dates are higher.

IV. Join the Dollar Bus Club

The Dollar Bus Club is a free email alert which emails you when a $1 bus fare was found in your city. Pretty neat!
